Articles.Content:
The Kronkus system

- Kopernicus Planet Pack by MrChumley

Click to view pics

This mod adds a ringed gas giant with 4 moons.  It is ready for career mode with full integration into the stock game.  Completely new biomes with custom science, and new secrets to discover. Textures have been optimized for quick loading, and low memory use.

 

Includes:

1 GAS GIANT

Kronkus: Huge purple ringed gas giant orbiting between Dres and Jool

4 MOONS

Eahpeh: The icy shepherd moon that weaves its way through the rings of Kronkus.

Kersex: It's the "Almost Kerbin" home away from home.  A whole new frontier with towering mountains, desolate deserts, and fjords that stretch as far as the eye can see.

Meelo: Next, is Meelo.  The middle moon.  Orbits outside Kersex.  It's monotone colors are home to the most "sensible" moon in the Kronkus system.

Scool: The outermost, tidally-locked, dusty snowball moon of the Kronkian system.

 

Known issues:

Kerbin space center "looks weird": Using Kerbin template causes the sky to be incorrect in the space center view. It is, however, correct in the flight view and the flight map view.

Kersex has extra ground station(s): The extra ground station is hard coded into the Kerbin template (Which Kersex relies on) and cannot be removed (as far as I know).  After extensive testing, I have determined that the extra base has minimal impact on gameplay.  During career mode the station cannot be upgraded so its range is extremely limited. Enabling extra ground stations is not recommended.

DOWNLOADS

Kronkus Releases

 

Source

________________________________________

 

(Requires Kopernicus and Module Manager)

Supports:

Optional: "FarOut" Contract Pack requires Contract Configurator

Galactic Neighborhood

Distant object enhancement bis

New Horizons compatible

Environmental visual enhancements (adds clouds to Kersex)

Research bodies

________________________

Add this optional config file to your Kronkus folder if you want to move Kerbin into orbit of Kronkus: MoveKerbin.cfg <~~~ Right click & Save as

 

Spoiler

License:

CC0- Full text @ http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/

To the extent possible under law, MrChumley (KSP forum thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/132379) has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to Kronkus.cfg, Meelo.cfg, Scool.cfg, Eahpeh.cfg, Kersex.cfg, and associated images. This work is published from: United States.

(11-6-2018)

v1.5

Added Localization

(9-25-17)

Small change to Kronkus rings.  For Kopernicus v1.3.0-8

(8-24-17)

Added EVE configs (clouds and shadows) for v1.2.2.1 compatibility

(5-31-17)

Rearranged moons

Updated descriptions

fixed Kronkus rings for the new shader

(3-9-16)

Removed Sketti

Added Scool

Rearranged orbits

(8-24-15)

Kronkus color textures created (Neptune+Vanor Colormaps) EVE rings

Sketti height/colormap created from a pic of noodles

(8-25-15)

Sketti atmo done (numbers mostly "borrowed" from New horizons)

Meelo created from a colormap of planet (Sheol) That I found while browsing google images

Eahpeh created from RSS textures of Europa, USGS lunar crater, and freehand editing

(8-26-15)

v0.1 alpha

Kersex heightmap created from USGS heightmaps of (Antarctica, Ireland, Sandwich Islands, Kauai, Malta) the weird ring structure came from a Minecraft heightmap.

Alpha release!

(8-27-15)

v0.1.1-alpha

changed orbit of Kronkus (between Dres & Jool)

Lots of work on Kersex, Texture pass, Atmospheric tinkering, size reduction and orbit change.

Made Eahpeh a moon of Kersex

Reduced some textures to 2048x1024

(9-2-15)

v0.2-beta

Texture pass

Converted textures to .dds

Science definitions added

Science returns balanced

other stuff

(9-6-15)

v0.3-beta

Fixed brightness problems on Kersex.

Terrain customizations.

(9-12-15)

V0.4-beta

Eahpeh makeover

Distant object enhancement compatibility patch added

Fixed minor spelling mistake in science definitions

(9-12-15)

v0.5-beta

Eahpeh texture revision to save memory

(9-13-15)

v0.6

Kronkus cloud texture

FULL RELEASE

(9-13-15)

v0.7

Kronkus E.V.E.(7-4) cloud support

(10-5-15)

v0.8-v0.9

Added New Horizons compatibility patch

Altered temperature heating curves for Kronkus, and Kersex (now you won't instantly explode from overheating).

Corrected directory structure

(10-9-15)

Kronkus v1.0

FPS issues fixed! (for real this time!)

Reworked Oceans on Kersex

Updated bundled Kopernicus to v0.4-beta

Added descriptions

Small change to New Horizons compatibility patch for Galactic neighborhood compatibility.

Lowered gravity on Eahpeh, and Meelo

 

Enjoy!

Edited November 6, 2018 by MrChumley
Kottabos is AWESOME!

What are the orbital parameters of this planet?

Edited August 24, 2015 by _Augustus_
Meeloo's colormap is a modified venus, right? Because if there is a way to make stuff like this yourself I'd love to know it

Augustus- I'm not sure if I understand your question. All parameters are subject to change.

Tellion- I got the textures for Meelo here LINK (it's the Sheol texture, I removed the color from it.)  You are right though, that IS a modified heightmap of Venus.

Sketti is a photoshopped pic of some noodles.

Kronkus is a a composite of a Neptune texture, and Vanor's texture overlayed and levels messed with...

The main continent on Kersex is Ireland (also Malta, and a Hawaiian island donated heightmaps from the USGS)

Edited March 9, 2017 by MrChumley

Meeloo's colormap is a modified venus, right? Because if there is a way to make stuff like this yourself I'd love to know it
Yeah it appears so.

Augustus- I'm not sure if I understand your question. All parameters are subject to change.

Tellion- I got the textures for Meelo here LINK (it's the Sheol texture, I removed the color from it.)

Sketti is a photoshopped pic of some noodles.

Kronkus is a a composite of a Neptune texture, and Vanor's texture overlayed and levels messed with...

I was asking about it's orbit

I was asking about it's orbit

No serious thought has gone into it's placement so far. The install I'm developing on has New Horizons installed (excellent as a reference), and right now it is just placed "wherever". I'm thinking it makes a good saturn/neptune analogue? So maybe just further out than jool for a stock, 1 system add-on. I started making this system as "filler" for my Asclepius system in the Galactic Neighborhood mod because Sigma refused to let different planet packs mingle, and I thought it would be pointless to travel to a diffrent star systems full of planets that you already visited.

Just finished another moon

(this one started out as the 4096 heightmap texture for Europa from RSS), then I pasted on a 512x512 USGS scan of a large lunar crater, then copy/resized/repasted/retouch/transformed a smaller canyon into the larger canyon). I also painted it a "super cool" Minmus motif. it also has some PQS things going on from it's Minmus template, but I thought it looked cool so I left it in.

I updated the d/l in the OP, and added a license

Will you put it between Moho and Eve in the stock game?

Why do you want a gas giant so close to the sun? It makes no sense!

On the other hand.. why not?

(D/L link in OP updated)
please do run this through an n-body integrator, I want to know what terrestrial planets go to interstellar space today

Why do you want a gas giant so close to the sun? It makes no sense!

On the other hand.. why not?

http://i.imgur.com/85Ica4h.png

(D/L link in OP updated)

Uhh, that would mess up the orbits of the other planets unless you made it inclined.

Hey guys!

1 more planet for this pack.

It's going to be a large terra planet.

So far I just have just spent a couple hours conglomerating a (4096x2048) heightmap.

It is made up if USGS scans of Ireland, Antarctica, one of the Sandwich islands, a highly edited northern coastline of Malta for the S pole continent, Kauai, and a cool ringed island that I found on a minecraft heightmap.

I named it Kersex.

Hey guys!

1 more planet for this pack.

It's going to be a large terra planet.

So far I just have just spent a couple hours conglomerating a (4096x2048) heightmap.

http://i.imgur.com/HvXx2j9l.jpg

It is made up if USGS scans of Ireland, Antarctica, one of the Sandwich islands, a highly edited northern coastline of Malta for the S pole continent, Kauai, and a cool ringed island that I found on a minecraft heightmap.

I named it Kersex.

Change that name, for the love of Kod.

Well, that picture shows only the scaled space, and the two lines that change the ScaledSpace textures are commented out in your configs.

If you land on the body, it should have your custom heightmap.

Thanks Thomas P

Yup you are right. I guess I was getting ahead of myself there...

Still a ways to go. But we have PROGRESS!!!

Update 8-26-15

Changes (Kronkus v0.1alpha)

  • Moved source to Github
  • Alpha release
  • STILL A WORK IN PROGRESS!
  • OUTSIDE CONTRIBUTIONS WELCOME!

(D/L links in OP updated)

Edited August 27, 2015 by MrChumley

Hey Guys!

This are coming along on the Kronkus system. Lots of changes have been made. Most of the major bugs are worked out. The system should be usable to "check it out" in it's current state.

Biomes and Science definitions are next on the agenda.

Update 8-27-15

Changes (Kronkus v0.1.1-alpha)

  • changed orbit of Kronkus (between Dres & Jool)
  • Lots of work on Kersex, Texture pass, Atmospheric tinkering, size reduction and orbit change.
  • Made Eahpeh a moon of Kersex
  • Reduced some textures to 2048x1024
  • OUTSIDE CONTRIBUTIONS CONTINUE TO BE WELCOMED!

(D/L links in OP updated)

Enjoy!

D/L Link

Biome maps complete!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I 've gone and overwhelmed myself here...

Is there anyone out there who is good at science definitions and wants to help? ...please?

Ok to make defining science as easy as possible I made a template .. there is like 300 science definitions to write! 


//
//			Kronkus Science Definitions
//			Template by MrChumley
//			
//
//
//

@EXPERIMENT_DEFINITION[*]:HAS[#id[surfaceSample]]
{
	@RESULTS
	{
		//SrfSplashed
		//SrfLanded
		//Kersex
		KersexSrfSplashedWater = You resist the urge to quench your thirst, and collect a sample of the liquid.
		KersexSrfLandedPeaks = You collect a sample which contains ice and pebbles.
		KersexSrfLandedHeights = You collect a sample of the soil.  You leave the worms in for extra science!
		KersexSrfLandedLowlands = The soil here seems rich and loamy.
		KersexSrfLandedDesert = You collect a sample of dessicated soil.
		KersexSrfLandedArctica = You collect a sample of partially frozen soil.
		KersexSrfLandedHenge = Will this sample explain the origins of this mysterious continent?  There is much science to do!
		KersexSrfLandedPoles = You collect a sample of the icy surface.
		//Sketti
		SkettiSrfLandedUpAboveIt = You collect a sample of the ground.  It has a tacky feel.
		SkettiSrfLandedDownInIt = You collect a sample of the surface.  It reminds you of Klay-Dough.
		//Meelo
		MeeloSrfLandedPeaks = The soil here consists of light colored highly dense pebbles and sand.
		MeeloSrfLandedMidlands = The soil here seems to have been recently disturbed.  You collect a sample.
		MeeloSrfLandedLowlands = The surface here consists of rubble, sand, and dust.  You expertly select a sample sized sample.
		MeeloSrfLandedMissedlands = You aren't quite sure what to make of this soil sample.  You process and catalogue your find.
		//Eahpeh
		EahpehSrfLandedIcesheet = You collect a sample of the green substance, it sublimates and fills your container with an unknown gas.
		EahpehSrfLandedSeepingBlue = You collect a sample of the blue surface material.  So this is where they get that blue stuff in re-usable icepacks!
	}
}

@EXPERIMENT_DEFINITION[*]:HAS[#id[crewReport]]
{
	@RESULTS
	{
		//FlyingLow
		//FlyingHigh
		//InSpace
		//InSpaceHigh
		//InSpaceLow
		//SrfSplashed
		//SrfLanded
		//Kronkus
		KronkusFlyingLow = We probably shouldn't be here.
		KronkusFlyingHigh = The sounds of plasma jets pulsing outside the craft are rather concerning.
		KronkusInSpaceLow = The crew reports sighting swirling pink clouds over a deep blue haze.
		KronkusInSpaceHigh = The crew is reporting in from high over Kronkus.
		//Kersex
		KersexFlyingLowPeaks = The crew reports that the peaks are indeed jagged!
		KersexFlyingLowHeights = The crew repors back with news of land that is astonishingly Kerbinlike!
		KersexFlyingLowWater = The crew reports amazing views over the oceans of Kersex!
		KersexFlyingLowLowlands = The crew reports sighting grasses and various plant life below!
		KersexFlyingLowDesert = Crew reporting in while flying low over the deserts of Kersex.
		KersexFlyingLowArctica = Crew reporting in while flying low over the Arctican continent! 
		KersexFlyingLowHenge = The crew reports an the amazing continent is even more amazing close up!
		KersexFlyingLowPoles = The crew reports that the poles are covered in ice.
		KersexFlyingHighPeaks = The crew is reporting in while flying high over the Peaks of Kersex.
		KersexFlyingHighHeights = The crew reports favorable drag in the atmosphere while flying over the heights of Kersex.
		KersexFlyingHighWater = The crew is reporting in from high over the ocean of Kersex!
		KersexFlyingHighLowlands = The crew reports low lying lands on Kersex!
		KersexFlyingHighDesert = The crew reports in with high altitude information of Kersex's atmosphere!
		KersexFlyingHighArctica = Crew reporting in from high in the atmosphere over Kersex.
		KersexFlyingHighHenge = The crew confirms the existance of a mysterious ringed geological feature while flying high over Kersex.
		KersexFlyingHighPoles = Crew reporting in while flying high over the poles of Kersex.
		KersexInSpace = The crew reports in with is latest observations while in space above Kersex.
		KersexInSpaceHigh = The crew confirms that Kersex does indeed resemble Kerbin.  Even in real life.
		KersexSrfSplashedWater = The crew confirms that the your spacecraft does indeed FLOAT!
		KersexSrfLandedPeaks = The crew reports in with tales of amazing views from the peaks of Kersex.
		KersexSrfLandedHeights = Crew reporting in from the beautiful heights of Kersex!
		KersexSrfLandedLowlands = The crew report is "Nominal" from the lowlands on Kersex.
		KersexSrfLandedDesert = The crew reports a lack of water in in the Kersex Desert.
		KersexSrfLandedArctica = The crew reports that the ground is nice and solid at Arctica on Kersex.
		KersexSrfLandedHenge = The crew reports their suspicions of terraforming but confirms that they are unconfirmed.
		KersexSrfLandedPoles = The crew reports that it is cold, and there is lots of ice on the surface of the poles at Kersex.
		//Sketti
		SkettiFlyingLowUpAboveIt = 
		SkettiFlyingHighUpAboveIt = 
		SkettiFlyingLowDownInIt = 
		SkettiFlyingHighDownInIt = 
		SkettiInSpaceHigh = 
		SkettiInSpaceLow = 
		SkettiSrfLandedUpAboveIt = 
		SkettiSrfLandedDownInIt = 
		//Meelo
		MeeloInSpaceHigh = 
		MeeloInSpaceLow = 
		MeeloSrfLandedPeaks = 
		MeeloSrfLandedMidlands = 
		MeeloSrfLandedLowlands = 
		MeeloSrfLandedMissedlands = 
		//Eahpeh
		EahpehInSpaceHigh = 
		EahpehInSpaceLow = 
		EahpehSrfLandedSeepingBlue = 
		EahpehSrfLandedIcesheet = 
	}
}

Looking good so far! Good luck developing this! I can't wait to see what will turn out of this!

hi mrchumley

is this supposed to go together with Asclepius?

or is this a completely separate mod?

Hi Jacob o/

Thanks for the kind words.

Ahoy Sigma88!

I started making this system as "filler" for my Asclepius system in the Galactic Neighborhood mod because Sigma refused to let different planet packs mingle, and I thought it would be pointless to travel to a diffrent star systems full of planets that you already visited.

So yes. it is intended to go together with Asclepius in Galactic Neighborhoods. I'm going to keep this a separate download though just so things don't get too confusing.

In other news, I'm burned out as far as writing science definitions goes for now. I'm just going to put what I have in and move on. (help is still welcome)

Next up will be balancing the Science returns.
